reviewText: The seventh episode of this second season, THE MOST DANGEROUS MATCH, was broadcasted on March 4th, 1973. It's also possible to watch this episode in the DVD standard by purchasing Columbo - The Complete Second Season. This is the second Columbo episode directed by Edward M. Abroms after Columbo Collector's Edition: Short Fuse. A chess grandmaster murders the challenger the night before the opening game. This is the best Columbo episode I've seen so far after two pilots and fourteen regular episodes. Emmett Clayton's nightmare, that opens THE MOST DANGEROUS MATCH, reminds us that the authors of Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Two-Disc Special Edition) (Harry Potter 1) were after all not so original when they imagined their human chess board. The scene in the Columbo episode is indeed very effective. Laurence The Alamo Harvey is also outstanding as the deaf grand master endowed with a phenomenal memory. A VHS to keep in your library.

Airdate March 4, 1973. This is another Columbo episode with superb writing, great acting and excellent drama. The Columbo series is one of the best TV series of all time. The episode is about 1 1/2 hours. This episode is concerning a grandmaster chess match.
